children.value: Change events represent service changes such as deploys, build completion, configuration updates, etc., providing contextual information that is critical during incident triage or hypercare. They can be sent via specific integrations, and they do not create alerts, incidents or notifications. See the
section below for a list of places where change events are surfaced in PagerDuty.
Configure an Integration to Send Change Events
Currently change events can be sent via these integrations:
You may follow the instructions in the linked integration guides to configure, or you can add them via the Recent Changes page.
Configure Integration via the Recent Changes Page
: If you would like to select a prebuilt integration, select your preferred vendor.
: Select this option if you would like to create custom change events with the PagerDuty Events API.
that you would like to add the integration to and click
On the next modal screen, copy your
to see how to use the integration key to configure the rest of the integration.
Send Change Events via the Events API
You may also send change events to integrations
for guidance on when to send a change event instead of an alert event. You can send both event types using a single Events API v2 integration key.

Is it possible to modify change events using event rules?
Not at this time, but we are interested to learn about what you would like to accomplish, please
with your use cases and feedback.
Are change events viewable in Slack or the mobile app?
Not at this time, but we would like to hear your feedback, please
